intro: Cyphostemma marunguense, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to elongated, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
